STK

2017/KER/49551
B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR, J.
Cri.M.C. No.5216 of 2013
Dated this the 7 day of December, 2017
ORDER
When this matter has been taken up for hearing, the
learned counsel for the petitioner has sought for
permission to withdraw this Crl.M.C. Permission stands
granted and this Crl.M.C. stands dismissed as withdrawn.
2. The learned counsel for the petitioner has
submitted that the second accused in this case, namely,
Naeem Ibrahim, who is the brother of the petitioner herein
had deposited an amount equivalent to the cheque
amount before the court below at the time of executing
the bond and the second accused is prepared to file an
affidavit before the court below stating that he has no
objection in releasing the above said amount to the
second respondent herein, who is the complainant before
the court below. The learned counsel for the second
respondent herein has submitted that if the above said
amount is released to the second respondent, he is

Euan
7 make
Bee

-32%-
prepared to withdraw the complaint.

3. This being the situation, it is directed that if the
second accused in this case files an affidavit before the
court below, within 15 days of receipt of this order stating
that he has no objection in releasing the amount
deposited by him in favour of the complainant, the court
below shall release the said amount to the complainant, if
the complainant is prepared to withdraw the complaint on
receipt of the said amount.

| make it clear that the personal attendance of the
petitioner or the second accused shall not be insisted by
the court below for the above purpose.

Sd/-
B. SUDHEENDRA KUMAR,
